args.name: tree
args.info: String of the SHA of the tree object this commit points to (required)

args.name: parents
args.info: Array of the SHAs of the commits that were the parents of this commit. If omitted or empty, the commit will be written as a root commit. For a single parent, an array of one SHA should be provided, for a merge commit, an array of more than one should be provided. (required)

args.name: ref
args.info: String of the name of the fully qualified reference (ie: heads/master). If it doesn’t have at least one slash, it will be rejected. (required)

args.name: object
args.info: String of the SHA of the git object this is tagging (required)

args.name: type
args.info: String of the type of the object we’re tagging. Normally this is a commit but it can also be a tree or a blob. (required)

args.name: tagger
args.info: JSON object that contains the following keys: `name` - String of the name of the author of the tag, `email` - String of the email of the author of the tag, `date` - Timestamp of when this object was tagged (required)

args.name: tree
args.info: Array of Hash objects (of path, mode, type and sha) specifying a tree structure (required)

args.name: baseTree
args.info: String of the SHA1 of the tree you want to update with new data (optional)

args.name: ref
args.info: String of the name of the fully qualified reference (ie: heads/master). If it doesn’t have at least one slash, it will be rejected. (required)

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of the results to fetch. (optional)

args.name: perPage
args.info: A custom page size up to 100. Default is 30. (optional)

args.name: force
args.info: Boolean indicating whether to force the update or to make sure the update is a fast-forward update. The default is false, so leaving this out or setting it to false will make sure you’re not overwriting work. (optional)

args.name: vcsUrl
args.info: The URL of the originating repository. (required)

args.info: The originating VCS type. Please be aware that without this parameter, the import job will take additional time to detect the VCS type before beginning the import. This detection step will be reflected in the response. (optional)

args.name: vcsUsername

args.name: vcsPassword

args.name: tfvcProject

args.name: repositories
args.info: A list of arrays indicating which repositories should be migrated. (required)

args.name: lockRepositories
args.info: Indicates whether repositories should be locked (to prevent manipulation) while migrating data. Default: false. (optional)

args.name: excludeAttachments
args.info: Indicates whether attachments should be excluded from the migration (to reduce migration archive file size). Default: false. (optional)

args.name: mode
args.info: The rendering mode, `markdown` to render a document as plain Markdown, just like README files are rendered. `gfm` to render a document as user-content, e.g. like user comments or issues are rendered. In GFM mode, hard line breaks are always taken into account, and issue and user mentions are linked accordingly. (optional)

args.name: context
args.info: The repository context. Only taken into account when rendering as `gfm` (optional)

args.name: permission
args.info: `pull` - team members can pull, but not push or administer this repository, `push` - team members can pull and push, but not administer this repository, `admin` - team members can pull, push and administer this repository. (optional)

args.name: base
args.info: The branch (or git ref) you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repo that requests a merge to a base of another repo. (required)

args.name: head

blocks.description: Create a new repository for the authenticated user.
blocks.name: createRepository

args.name: private
args.info: True to create a private repository, false to create a public one. Creating private repositories requires a paid GitHub account. Default is false. (optional)

args.name: hasIssues
args.info: True to enable issues for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true. (optional)

args.name: hasWiki
args.info: True to enable the wiki for this repository, false to disable it. Default is true. (optional)

args.name: hasDownloads
args.info: True to enable downloads for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true. (optional)

args.name: autoInit
args.info: True to create an initial commit with empty README. Default is false (optional)

args.name: gitignoreTemplate
args.info: Desired language or platform .gitignore template to apply. Ignored if auto_init parameter is not provided. (optional)

args.name: licenseTemplate
args.info: Desired LICENSE template to apply. Use the name of the template without the extension. For example, "mit" or "mozilla". (optional)

args.name: allowSquashMerge
args.info: Either true to allow squash-merging pull requests, or false to prevent squash-merging. Default: true. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: allowMergeCommit
args.info: Either true to allow merging pull requests with a merge commit, or false to prevent merging pull requests with merge commits. Default: true. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: allowRebaseMerge
args.info: Either true to allow rebase-merging pull requests, or false to prevent rebase-merging. Default: true. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: path
args.info: Relative path of the file to comment on. (optional)

args.name: position
args.info: Line index in the diff to comment on. (optional)

args.name: line
args.info: Deprecated. Use position parameter instead. Line number in the file to comment on. (optional)

args.name: ref
args.info: The ref to deploy. This can be a branch, tag, or sha. (required)

args.name: task
args.info: The named task to execute. e.g. deploy or deploy:migrations. Default: deploy (optional)

args.name: autoMerge
args.info: Optional parameter to merge the default branch into the requested ref if it is behind the default branch. Default: true (optional)

args.name: requiredContexts
args.info: Optional array of status contexts verified against commit status checks. If this parameter is omitted from the parameters then all unique contexts will be verified before a deployment is created. To bypass checking entirely pass an empty array. Defaults to all unique contexts. (optional)

args.name: payload
args.info: Optional JSON payload with extra information about the deployment. Default: "" (optional)

args.name: environment
args.info: The name of the environment that was deployed to. e.g. staging or production. Default: none. (optional)

args.name: transientEnvironment
args.info: Specifies if the given environment is specific to the deployment and will no longer exist at some point in the future. Default: false. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: productionEnvironment
args.info: Specifies if the given environment is a one that end-users directly interact with. Default: true when environment is `production` and false otherwise. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: state
args.info: The state of the status. Can be one of pending, success, error, or failure. (optional)

args.name: targetUrl
args.info: The target URL to associate with this status. This URL should contain output to keep the user updated while the task is running or serve as historical information for what happened in the deployment. Default: "" (optional)

args.name: logUrl
args.info: Functionally equivalent to target_url. Default: "". (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: description
args.info: A short description of the status. Default: "" (optional)

args.name: environmentUrl
args.info: URL for accessing the deployment environment. Default: "". (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: autoInactive
args.info: When true the new `inactive` status is added to all other non-transient, non-production environment deployments with the same repository and environment name as the created status's deployment. Default: true. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

blocks.description: Create a new file in the given repository.
blocks.name: createRepositoryFile

args.name: content
args.info: The new file content, Base64 encoded. (required)

args.name: branch
args.info: The branch name. If not provided, uses the repository’s default branch (usually master). (optional)

blocks.description: Create a new repository for an organization.
blocks.name: createRepositoryForOrganization

args.name: private
args.info: True to create a private repository, false to create a public one. Creating private repositories requires a paid GitHub account. Default is false. (optional)

args.name: hasIssues
args.info: True to enable issues for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true. (optional)

args.name: hasWiki
args.info: True to enable the wiki for this repository, false to disable it. Default is true. (optional)

args.name: hasDownloads
args.info: True to enable downloads for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true. (optional)

args.name: teamId
args.info: The id of the team that will be granted access to this repository. This is only valid when creating a repo in an organization. (optional)

args.name: autoInit
args.info: True to create an initial commit with empty README. Default is false (optional)

args.name: gitignoreTemplate
args.info: Desired language or platform .gitignore template to apply. Ignored if auto_init parameter is not provided. (optional)

args.name: licenseTemplate
args.info: Desired LICENSE template to apply. Use the name of the template without the extension. For example, "mit" or "mozilla". (optional)

args.name: allowSquashMerge
args.info: Either true to allow squash-merging pull requests, or false to prevent squash-merging. Default: true. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: allowMergeCommit
args.info: Either true to allow merging pull requests with a merge commit, or false to prevent merging pull requests with merge commits. Default: true. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: allowRebaseMerge
args.info: Either true to allow rebase-merging pull requests, or false to prevent rebase-merging. Default: true. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: config
args.info: A Hash containing key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repo. Booleans are stored internally as `1` for true, and `0` for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically. (required)

args.name: events
args.info: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. Default: `['push']`. (optional)

args.name: active
args.info: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes. (optional)

args.name: readOnly
args.info: If true, the key will only be able to read repository contents. Otherwise, the key will be able to read and write. (optional)

args.name: contentId
args.info: The id of the Issue or Pull Request to associate with this card. (optional)

args.name: contentType
args.info: The type of content to associate with this card. Can be either 'Issue' or 'PullRequest'. (optional)

args.name: targetCommitish
args.info: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually master). (optional)

args.name: draft
args.info: true to create a draft (unpublished) release, false to create a published one. Default: false (optional)

args.name: prerelease
args.info: true to identify the release as a prerelease. false to identify the release as a full release. Default: false (optional)

args.name: state
args.info: State of the status - can be one of pending, success, error, or failure. (required)

args.name: targetUrl
args.info: Target url to associate with this status. This URL will be linked from the GitHub UI to allow users to easily see the ‘source’ of the Status. (optional)

args.name: context
args.info: A string label to differentiate this status from the status of other systems. (optional)

args.name: sha
args.info: The blob SHA of the file being removed. (required)

args.name: branch
args.info: The branch name. If not provided, uses the repository’s default branch (usually master). (optional)

blocks.description: Delete a repository invitation. (In preview period. See README.)
blocks.name: deleteRepositoryInvite

args.name: private
args.info: True to create a private repository, false to create a public one. Creating private repositories requires a paid GitHub account. Default is false. (optional)

args.name: hasIssues
args.info: True to enable issues for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true. (optional)

args.name: hasWiki
args.info: True to enable the wiki for this repository, false to disable it. Default is true. (optional)

args.name: hasDownloads
args.info: True to enable downloads for this repository, false to disable them. Default is true. (optional)

args.name: defaultBranch
args.info: Updates the default branch for this repository. (optional)

args.name: allowSquashMerge
args.info: Either true to allow squash-merging pull requests, or false to prevent squash-merging. Default: true. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: allowMergeCommit
args.info: Either true to allow merging pull requests with a merge commit, or false to prevent merging pull requests with merge commits. Default: true. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: allowRebaseMerge
args.info: Either true to allow rebase-merging pull requests, or false to prevent rebase-merging. Default: true. (In preview period. See README.) (optional)

args.name: label
args.info: An alternate short description of the asset. Used in place of the filename. (optional)

args.name: config
args.info: A Hash containing key/value pairs to provide settings for this hook. Modifying this will replace the entire config object. These settings vary between the services and are defined in the github-services repo. Booleans are stored internally as `1` for true, and `0` for false. Any JSON true/false values will be converted automatically. (required)

args.name: events
args.info: Determines what events the hook is triggered for. This replaces the entire array of events. Default: `['push']`. (optional)

args.name: addEvents
args.info: Determines a list of events to be added to the list of events that the Hook triggers for. (optional)

args.name: removeEvents
args.info: Determines a list of events to be removed from the list of events that the Hook triggers for. (optional)

args.name: active
args.info: Determines whether the hook is actually triggered on pushes. (optional)

args.name: targetCommitish
args.info: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually master). (optional)

args.name: draft
args.info: true to create a draft (unpublished) release, false to create a published one. Default: false (optional)

args.name: prerelease
args.info: true to identify the release as a prerelease. false to identify the release as a full release. Default: false (optional)

args.name: organization
args.info: Optional parameter to specify the organization name if forking into an organization. (optional)

args.info: A custom page size up to 100. Default is 30. (optional)

args.name: base
args.info: The branch (or git ref) you want your changes pulled into. This should be an existing branch on the current repository. You cannot submit a pull request to one repo that requests a merge to a base of another repo. (required)

args.name: head
args.info: The branch (or git ref) where your changes are implemented. (required)

args.name: commitMessage
args.info: Commit message to use for the merge commit. If omitted, a default message will be used. (optional)

args.name: position
args.info: Can be one of first, last, or after:<column-id>, where <column-id> is the id value of a column in the same project. (required)

args.name: columnId
args.info: The id value of a column in the same project. (optional)

blocks.description: Update branch protection. (In preview period. See README.)
blocks.name: updateRepositoryBranchProtection

args.name: requiredStatusChecks
args.info: JSON object that contains the following keys: `include_admins` - Enforce required status checks for repository administrators, `strict` - Require branches to be up to date before merging, `contexts` - The list of status checks to require in order to merge into this branch. This object can have the value of `null` for disabled. (required)

args.name: restrictions
args.info: JSON object that contains the following keys: `users` - The list of user logins with push access, `teams` - The list of team slugs with push access. This object can have the value of `null` for disabled. (required)

args.name: page
args.info: Page number of the results to fetch. (optional)

args.name: perPage
args.info: A custom page size up to 100. Default is 30. (optional)

args.name: content
args.info: The updated file content, Base64 encoded. (required)

args.name: sha
args.info: The blob SHA of the file being replaced. (required)

args.name: branch
args.info: The branch name. If not provided, uses the repository’s default branch (usually master). (optional)

args.info: The file path of the asset. (required)

args.info: The file name of the asset. This should be set in a URI query parameter. (required)

args.name: label
args.info: An alternate short description of the asset. Used in place of the filename. This should be set in a URI query parameter. (optional)

args.name: sort
args.info: The sort field. Can only be indexed, which indicates how recently a file has been indexed by the GitHub search infrastructure. Default: results are sorted by best match. (optional)
